15#ifndef DNS_DNSSEC_H
16#define DNS_DNSSEC_H 1
17
18/*! \file dns/dnssec.h */
19
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/stdtime.h>
24#include <isc/stats.h>
25
26#include <dns/diff.h>
27#include <dns/types.h>
28
29#include <dst/dst.h>
30
31ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
32
33LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern isc_stats_t *dns_dnssec_stats;
34
35/*%< Maximum number of keys supported in a zone. */
36#define DNS_MAXZONEKEYS 32
37
38/*
39 * Indicates how the signer found this key: in the key repository, at the
40 * zone apex, or specified by the user.
41 */
42typedef enum {
43 dns_keysource_unknown,
44 dns_keysource_repository,
45 dns_keysource_zoneapex,
46 dns_keysource_user
47} dns_keysource_t;
48
49/*
50 * A DNSSEC key and hints about its intended use gleaned from metadata
51 */
52struct dns_dnsseckey {
53 dst_key_t *key;
54 bool hint_publish; /*% metadata says to publish */
55 bool force_publish; /*% publish regardless of metadata */
56 bool hint_sign; /*% metadata says to sign with this key */
57 bool force_sign; /*% sign with key regardless of metadata */
58 bool hint_remove; /*% metadata says *don't* publish */
59 bool is_active; /*% key is already active */
60 bool first_sign; /*% key is newly becoming active */
61 unsigned int prepublish; /*% how long until active? */
62 dns_keysource_t source; /*% how the key was found */
63 bool ksk; /*% this is a key-signing key */
64 bool legacy; /*% this is old-style key with no
65 metadata (possibly generated by
66 an older version of BIND9) and
67 should be ignored when searching
68 for keys to import into the zone */
69 unsigned int index; /*% position in list */
70 ISC_LINK(dns_dnsseckey_t) link;
71};
72
73isc_result_t
74dns_dnssec_keyfromrdata(const dns_name_t *name, const dns_rdata_t *rdata,
75 isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **key);
76/*%<
77 * Creates a DST key from a DNS record. Basically a wrapper around
78 * dst_key_fromdns().
79 *
80 * Requires:
81 *\li 'name' is not NULL
82 *\li 'rdata' is not NULL
83 *\li 'mctx' is not NULL
84 *\li 'key' is not NULL
85 *\li '*key' is NULL
86 *
87 * Returns:
88 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
89 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
90 *\li DST_R_INVALIDPUBLICKEY
91 *\li various errors from dns_name_totext
92 */
93
94isc_result_t
95dns_dnssec_sign(const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdataset_t *set, dst_key_t *key,
96 isc_stdtime_t *inception, isc_stdtime_t *expire,
97 isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t *buffer, dns_rdata_t *sigrdata);
98/*%<
99 * Generates a RRSIG record covering this rdataset. This has no effect
100 * on existing RRSIG records.
101 *
102 * Requires:
103 *\li 'name' (the owner name of the record) is a valid name
104 *\li 'set' is a valid rdataset
105 *\li 'key' is a valid key
106 *\li 'inception' is not NULL
107 *\li 'expire' is not NULL
108 *\li 'mctx' is not NULL
109 *\li 'buffer' is not NULL
110 *\li 'sigrdata' is not NULL
111 *
112 * Returns:
113 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
114 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
115 *\li #ISC_R_NOSPACE
116 *\li #DNS_R_INVALIDTIME - the expiration is before the inception
117 *\li #DNS_R_KEYUNAUTHORIZED - the key cannot sign this data (either
118 * it is not a zone key or its flags prevent
119 * authentication)
120 *\li DST_R_*
121 */
122
123isc_result_t
124dns_dnssec_verify(const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdataset_t *set, dst_key_t *key,
125 bool ignoretime, unsigned int maxbits,
126 isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_rdata_t *sigrdata, dns_name_t *wild);
127/*%<
128 * Verifies the RRSIG record covering this rdataset signed by a specific
129 * key. This does not determine if the key's owner is authorized to sign
130 * this record, as this requires a resolver or database.
131 * If 'ignoretime' is true, temporal validity will not be checked.
132 *
133 * 'maxbits' specifies the maximum number of rsa exponent bits accepted.
134 *
135 * Requires:
136 *\li 'name' (the owner name of the record) is a valid name
137 *\li 'set' is a valid rdataset
138 *\li 'key' is a valid key
139 *\li 'mctx' is not NULL
140 *\li 'sigrdata' is a valid rdata containing a SIG record
141 *\li 'wild' if non-NULL then is a valid and has a buffer.
142 *
143 * Returns:
144 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
145 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
146 *\li #DNS_R_FROMWILDCARD - the signature is valid and is from
147 * a wildcard expansion. dns_dnssec_verify2() only.
148 * 'wild' contains the name of the wildcard if non-NULL.
149 *\li #DNS_R_SIGINVALID - the signature fails to verify
150 *\li #DNS_R_SIGEXPIRED - the signature has expired
151 *\li #DNS_R_SIGFUTURE - the signature's validity period has not begun
152 *\li #DNS_R_KEYUNAUTHORIZED - the key cannot sign this data (either
153 * it is not a zone key or its flags prevent
154 * authentication)
155 *\li DST_R_*
156 */
157
158/*@{*/
159isc_result_t
160dns_dnssec_findzonekeys(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
161 dns_dbnode_t *node, const dns_name_t *name,
162 const char *directory, isc_stdtime_t now,
163 isc_mem_t *mctx, unsigned int maxkeys,
164 dst_key_t **keys, unsigned int *nkeys);
165
166/*%<
167 * Finds a set of zone keys.
168 * XXX temporary - this should be handled in dns_zone_t.
169 */
170/*@}*/
171
172bool
173dns_dnssec_keyactive(dst_key_t *key, isc_stdtime_t now);
174/*%<
175 *
176 * Returns true if 'key' is active as of the time specified
177 * in 'now' (i.e., if the activation date has passed, inactivation or
178 * deletion date has not yet been reached, and the key is not revoked
179 * -- or if it is a legacy key without metadata). Otherwise returns
180 * false.
181 *
182 * Requires:
183 *\li 'key' is a valid key
184 */
185
186isc_result_t
187dns_dnssec_signmessage(dns_message_t *msg, dst_key_t *key);
188/*%<
189 * Signs a message with a SIG(0) record. This is implicitly called by
190 * dns_message_renderend() if msg->sig0key is not NULL.
191 *
192 * Requires:
193 *\li 'msg' is a valid message
194 *\li 'key' is a valid key that can be used for signing
195 *
196 * Returns:
197 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
198 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
199 *\li DST_R_*
200 */
201
202isc_result_t
203dns_dnssec_verifymessage(isc_buffer_t *source, dns_message_t *msg,
204 dst_key_t *key);
205/*%<
206 * Verifies a message signed by a SIG(0) record. This is not
207 * called implicitly by dns_message_parse(). If dns_message_signer()
208 * is called before dns_dnssec_verifymessage(), it will return
209 * #DNS_R_NOTVERIFIEDYET. dns_dnssec_verifymessage() will set
210 * the verified_sig0 flag in msg if the verify succeeds, and
211 * the sig0status field otherwise.
212 *
213 * Requires:
214 *\li 'source' is a valid buffer containing the unparsed message
215 *\li 'msg' is a valid message
216 *\li 'key' is a valid key
217 *
218 * Returns:
219 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
220 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
221 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND - no SIG(0) was found
222 *\li #DNS_R_SIGINVALID - the SIG record is not well-formed or
223 * was not generated by the key.
224 *\li DST_R_*
225 */
226
227bool
228dns_dnssec_selfsigns(dns_rdata_t *rdata, const dns_name_t *name,
229 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset,
230 bool ignoretime, isc_mem_t *mctx);
231
232
233bool
234dns_dnssec_signs(dns_rdata_t *rdata, const dns_name_t *name,
235 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset,
236 bool ignoretime, isc_mem_t *mctx);
237/*%<
238 * Verify that 'rdataset' is validly signed in 'sigrdataset' by
239 * the key in 'rdata'.
240 *
241 * dns_dnssec_selfsigns() requires that rdataset be a DNSKEY or KEY
242 * rrset. dns_dnssec_signs() works on any rrset.
243 */
244
245
246isc_result_t
247dns_dnsseckey_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **dstkey,
248 dns_dnsseckey_t **dkp);
249/*%<
250 * Create and initialize a dns_dnsseckey_t structure.
251 *
252 * Requires:
253 *\li 'dkp' is not NULL and '*dkp' is NULL.
254 *
255 * Returns:
256 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
257 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
258 */
259
260void
261dns_dnsseckey_destroy(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_dnsseckey_t **dkp);
262/*%<
263 * Reclaim a dns_dnsseckey_t structure.
264 *
265 * Requires:
266 *\li 'dkp' is not NULL and '*dkp' is not NULL.
267 *
268 * Ensures:
269 *\li '*dkp' is NULL.
270 */
271
272isc_result_t
273dns_dnssec_findmatchingkeys(const dns_name_t *origin, const char *directory,
274 isc_stdtime_t now, isc_mem_t *mctx,
275 dns_dnsseckeylist_t *keylist);
276/*%<
277 * Search 'directory' for K* key files matching the name in 'origin'.
278 * Append all such keys, along with use hints gleaned from their
279 * metadata, onto 'keylist'. Skip any unsupported algorithms.
280 *
281 * Requires:
282 *\li 'keylist' is not NULL
283 *
284 * Returns:
285 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
286 *\li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
287 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
288 *\li any error returned by dns_name_totext(), isc_dir_open(), or
289 * dst_key_fromnamedfile()
290 *
291 * Ensures:
292 *\li On error, keylist is unchanged
293 */
294
295isc_result_t
296dns_dnssec_keylistfromrdataset(const dns_name_t *origin,
297 const char *directory, isc_mem_t *mctx,
298 dns_rdataset_t *keyset, dns_rdataset_t *keysigs,
299 dns_rdataset_t *soasigs, bool savekeys,
300 bool publickey,
301 dns_dnsseckeylist_t *keylist);
302/*%<
303 * Append the contents of a DNSKEY rdataset 'keyset' to 'keylist'.
304 * Omit duplicates. If 'publickey' is false, search 'directory' for
305 * matching key files, and load the private keys that go with
306 * the public ones. If 'savekeys' is true, mark the keys so
307 * they will not be deleted or inactivated regardless of metadata.
308 *
309 * 'keysigs' and 'soasigs', if not NULL and associated, contain the
310 * RRSIGS for the DNSKEY and SOA records respectively and are used to mark
311 * whether a key is already active in the zone.
312 */
313
314isc_result_t
315dns_dnssec_updatekeys(dns_dnsseckeylist_t *keys, dns_dnsseckeylist_t *newkeys,
316 dns_dnsseckeylist_t *removed, const dns_name_t *origin,
317 dns_ttl_t hint_ttl, dns_diff_t *diff, bool allzsk,
318 isc_mem_t *mctx, void (*report)(const char *, ...));
319/*%<
320 * Update the list of keys in 'keys' with new key information in 'newkeys'.
321 *
322 * For each key in 'newkeys', see if it has a match in 'keys'.
323 * - If not, and if the metadata says the key should be published:
324 * add it to 'keys', and place a dns_difftuple into 'diff' so
325 * the key can be added to the DNSKEY set. If the metadata says it
326 * should be active, set the first_sign flag.
327 * - If so, and if the metadata says it should be removed:
328 * remove it from 'keys', and place a dns_difftuple into 'diff' so
329 * the key can be removed from the DNSKEY set. if 'removed' is non-NULL,
330 * copy the key into that list; otherwise destroy it.
331 * - Otherwise, make sure keys has current metadata.
332 *
333 * If 'allzsk' is true, we are allowing KSK-flagged keys to be used as
334 * ZSKs.
335 *
336 * 'hint_ttl' is the TTL to use for the DNSKEY RRset if there is no
337 * existing RRset, and if none of the keys to be added has a default TTL
338 * (in which case we would use the shortest one). If the TTL is longer
339 * than the time until a new key will be activated, then we have to delay
340 * the key's activation.
341 *
342 * 'report' points to a function for reporting status.
343 *
344 * On completion, any remaining keys in 'newkeys' are freed.
345 */
346
347isc_result_t
348dns_dnssec_syncupdate(dns_dnsseckeylist_t *keys, dns_dnsseckeylist_t *rmkeys,
349 dns_rdataset_t *cds, dns_rdataset_t *cdnskey,
350 isc_stdtime_t now, dns_ttl_t hint_ttl, dns_diff_t *diff,
351 isc_mem_t *mctx);
352/*%<
353 * Update the CDS and CDNSKEY RRsets, adding and removing keys as needed.
354 */
355
356ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
357
358#endif /* DNS_DNSSEC_H */
359
